subtitleNullable: Diverse streaming data with song features and scrobble activities
descriptionNullable:
_____
# Streaming Activity and Scrobble Features
### Diverse streaming data with song features and scrobble activities
By Sean Miller [[source]](https://data.world/kcmillersean)
_____

### About this dataset
> This dataset provides a comprehensive and diverse collection of internet streaming data, covering a span of four years. It includes streaming activities and scrobble features from various platforms and devices, such as YouTube, Spotify, local iTunes library, and Amazon Echo. The data is sourced from a household with a wide age range, encompassing individuals from birth to 38 years old.
> 
> With an extensive range of columns, this dataset offers in-depth insights into music consumption patterns and preferences. Key attributes captured include the performer or artist name (**Performer**), song title (**Song**), Spotify genre tags (**spotify_genre**), URL for the Spotify track preview (**spotify_track_preview_url**), duration of the song in milliseconds (**spotify_track_duration_ms**), popularity score on Spotify (measured by **spotify_track_popularity**), explicit content indicator (represented by **spotify_track_explicit** flag), danceability rating (**danceability**), energy level (**energy**), key of the song's composition (**key**) in musical notation format (e.g., C sharp or D flat major/minor scale).
> 
> Additionally, other valuable metrics include sound loudness measured in decibels (dB) (**loudness**) that defines the overall volume intensity present within each song. The mode attribute indicates whether the song is composed primarily in a major or minor key tonality system (`major` or `minor` values respectively). Speechiness measure quantifies the presence of spoken words within a given track on a numerical scale(**speechiness**) while acousticness score determines how much acoustic quality is exhibited with larger values indicating more prominent acoustic elements(**acousticness)**.
> 
> The dataset also profiles instrumentalness score which implies whether a particular track leans more towards instrumental music without significant vocal components. Liveness metric assesses live audience presence during musical performances based on recorded sound characteristics(*liveness*). Valence measures the positiveness conveyed through melodic aspects inducing emotional response(**valence**), and tempo indicates the speed or pace of the song in beats per minute(BPM)(**tempo**). Time signature represents the rhythmic structure of a song, defined by numerator indicating beats per bar and denominator indicating note value that represents one beat(**time_signature**).
> 
> The dataset includes information about scrobble timestamps in Central Time Zone (**TimeStamp_Central**) as well as Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)(**TimeStamp_UTC**) to provide comprehensive insights into streaming trends with a geographic perspective.
> 
> In summary, this rich dataset offers valuable information on music streaming preferences, ranging from detailed song attributes to user activity timestamps. It

### How to use the dataset
> 
> - Introduction:
> 
> - Dataset Overview:
>    The dataset is available in two files: Scrobble_Features.csv and My Streaming Activity.csv. 
>    - Scrobble_Features.csv: This file includes detailed information about song features, such as danceability, energy, key, loudness, mode, speechiness, acousticness, instrumentalness, liveness,valence,tempo,time_signature etc.
>    - My Streaming Activity.csv: This file contains information about the streaming activities like performer,song,time stamps(album,data time utc/central) etc.
> 
> - Columns Description:
>    Each column in the dataset provides specific information related to the songs or streaming activities. Here are some important columns:
> 
> - Performer: This column represents the name of the artist or performer of each song.
> - Song: This column provides the title of each song.
> - spotify_genre: It indicates genre(s) of each song according to Spotify's classification.
> - spotify_track_preview_url : an url indicating where can you find a preview od te fragmentof ech songs,
> - spotify_track_duration_ms : duration indication in miliseconds,
>   
> Important Columns for analyzing Songs/Trends:
> 
> 
> *spotify_track_popularity:* Popularity score measures on Spotify for each individual songs
> *danceability:* A measure representing how suitable a song is for dancing based on musical elements
> *energy:* An indicator that reflects how intense or active a particular track is
> *loudness:* The overall volume level (loudness) represented by decibels (dB)
> *mode:* It represents whether the song is in a major or minor key
> *speechiness:* Represents the presence of spoken words in a song
> *acousticness:* This metric measures the acoustic quality of each song
> *instrumentalness:* Represents the likelihood that a particular song is instrumental
> *liveness:* Reflects on how much presence of live audience there is in each song. It shows a measure where higher values indicate more likeliness of representing live performances.
> valence: A measure that represents musical positiveness conveyed by each song
> 
> 
> - Analyzing Song Features:
>    The dataset provides a variety of numerical and categorical features to

### Research Ideas
> - Music recommendation system: With information on song features such as danceability, energy, and valence, this dataset can be used to develop a music recommendation system that suggests songs based on the user's preferences and mood.
> - Analyzing streaming trends: By analyzing the streaming activity data over time, it is possible to identify popular songs and genres, peak listening hours, and the impact of external factors (e.g., events, holidays) on music consumption.
> - Exploring musical preferences across different age groups: Since this dataset includes streaming data from a household with a wide age range, it can be used to analyze and compare musical preferences across different demographics. This analysis can provide insights into how music tastes vary based on factors like age or generation

### Acknowledgements
> If you use this dataset in your research, please credit the original authors.
> [Data Source](https://data.world/kcmillersean)
> 
>


### License
> 
> 
> See the dataset description for more information.

### Columns

**File: Scrobble_Features.csv**
| Column name                   | Description                                                                                               |
|:------------------------------|:----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| **Performer**                 | The name of the artist or performer of the song. (Text)                                                   |
| **Song**                      | The title of the song. (Text)                                                                             |
| **spotify_genre**             | The genre(s) of the song according to Spotify. (Text)                                                     |
| **spotify_track_preview_url** | The URL of a preview of the song on Spotify. (Text)                                                       |
| **spotify_track_duration_ms** | The duration of the song in milliseconds. (Numeric)                                                       |
| **spotify_track_popularity**  | The popularity score of the song on Spotify. (Numeric)                                                    |
| **spotify_track_explicit**    | Indicates whether the song contains explicit content (Boolean)                                            |
| **danceability**              | A measure indicating how suitable a song is for dancing based on musical elements. (Numeric)              |
| **energy**                    | A measure determining the intensity and activity level within a song. (Numeric)                           |
| **key**                       | The key in which a particular track is composed (e.g., C, D, E). (Text)                                   |
| **loudness**                  | The overall volume level of the song expressed in decibels. (Numeric)                                     |
| **mode**                      | Indicates whether the song is in a major or minor key. (Text)                                             |
| **speechiness**               | Gauges the presence of spoken words within a song. (Numeric)                                              |
| **acousticness**              | A measure indicating the extent of acoustic qualities within a track. (Numeric)                           |
| **instrumentalness**          | Estimates the likelihood that a song is instrumental in nature. (Numeric)                                 |
| **liveness**                  | Assesses if live audience participation can be detected within tracks. (Numeric)                          |
| **valence**                   | A measure quantifying musical positiveness conveyed by each track. (Numeric)                              |
| **tempo**                     | The beat per minute (BPM) providing insight into pacing or rhythm. (Numeric)                              |
| **time_signature**            | Detailed key and time signature attributes offering further insights into musical characteristics. (Text) |

_____

**File: My Streaming Activity.csv**
| Column name           | Description                                                                                      |
|:----------------------|:-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| **Performer**         | The name of the artist or performer of the song. (Text)                                          |
| **Song**              | The title of the song. (Text)                                                                    |
| **TimeStamp_Central** | The timestamp of the streaming activity recorded in the Central Time Zone. (DateTime)            |
| **Album**             | The name of the album to which the song belongs. (Text)                                          |
| **TimeStamp_UTC**     | The timestamp of the streaming activity recorded in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). (DateTime) |

### Acknowledgements
> If you use this dataset in your research, please credit the original authors.
> If you use this dataset in your research, please credit [Sean Miller](https://data.world/kcmillersean).

### Research Ideas
> - Music recommendation system: With information on song features such as danceability, energy, and valence, this dataset can be used to develop a music recommendation system that suggests songs based on the user's preferences and mood.

| **energy**                    | A measure determining the intensity and activity level within a song. (Numeric)                           |
| **key**                       | The key in which a particular track is composed (e.g., C, D, E). (Text)                                   |
| **loudness**                  | The overall volume level of the song expressed in decibels. (Numeric)                                     |
| **mode**                      | Indicates whether the song is in a major or minor key. (Text)                                             |
| **speechiness**               | Gauges the presence of spoken words within a song. (Numeric)                                              |
| **acousticness**              | A measure indicating the extent of acoustic qualities within a track. (Numeric)                           |
| **instrumentalness**          | Estimates the likelihood that a song is instrumental in nature. (Numeric)                                 |
| **liveness**                  | Assesses if live audience participation can be detected within tracks. (Numeric)                          |
| **valence**                   | A measure quantifying musical positiveness conveyed by each track. (Numeric)                              |
| **tempo**                     | The beat per minute (BPM) providing insight into pacing or rhythm. (Numeric)                              |
| **time_signature**            | Detailed key and time signature attributes offering further insights into musical characteristics. (Text) |

_____

**File: My Streaming Activity.csv**
| Column name           | Description                                                                                      |
|:----------------------|:-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| **Performer**         | The name of the artist or performer of the song. (Text)                                          |
| **Song**              | The title of the song. (Text)                                                                    |
| **TimeStamp_Central** | The timestamp of the streaming activity recorded in the Central Time Zone. (DateTime)            |
| **Album**             | The name of the album to which the song belongs. (Text)                                          |
| **TimeStamp_UTC**     | The timestamp of the streaming activity recorded in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). (DateTime) |
